benchmark_details.name: Fundamental Problems With Model Editing: How Should Rational Belief Revision Work in LLMs?
benchmark_details.overview: This paper critiques the standard formulation of the model editing problem and proposes a semi-synthetic testbed for model editing research. It introduces a dataset based on Wikidata for evaluating model edits against labels given by an idealized Bayesian agent.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a formal testbed for evaluating model editing methods in language models against Bayesian standards.

data.source: Generated from Wikidata with a focus on factual entailment and logical coherence.
data.annotation: Developed with semi-synthetic methods including Bayesian posteriors for training and evaluation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by comparing model probabilities against Bayesian posterior probabilities and logical axioms.
methodology.interpretation: Better model edits should achieve high generative accuracy and maintain logical coherence with Bayesian principles.
methodology.validation: The benchmark is validated against a Bayesian modelâ€™s expectations after editing an LLM.
